means: [人名] [英格兰人姓氏] 布洛 Blower的变体

word_mean: 锤头向下运动时所积蓄的动能在极短的时间内(一般只有千分之几秒)释放出来，使锻件获得塑性变形的过程。
off 玻璃瓶罐头杀菌时瓶盖跳脱现象。

sentence.Network_en: His resignation was a body blow to the team.
sentence.Network_cn: 他的辞职是对该队的沉重打击。

sentence.Network_en: But Ivanisevic's no-show will be a blow for Wimbledon chiefs.
sentence.Network_cn: 但伊万尼塞维奇不能参赛对温布尔登主办方将是一个重大打击。

sentence.Network_en: He killed his tyrannical father with a blow to the head.
sentence.Network_cn: 他冲着暴戾的父亲的头部猛击了一下，把他打死了。

jx.jx_en_mean: To kill by shooting, especially with a firearm.
To affect intensely; overwhelm
To arrive, especially when unexpected.
To relieve or release (pressure); let off.
To extinguish or be extinguished by a gust of air
To fail, as an electrical apparatus.
To erupt in an uncontrolled manner. Used of a gas or oil well.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 爆发：以势不可挡之势爆发。用于指煤气或油井

jx.jx_en_mean: To subside, wane, or pass over with little lasting effect

lj.lj_ly: The storm blew over quickly. The scandal will soon blow over.
lj.lj_ls: 风暴迅速减退。丑闻将很快销声匿迹

jx.jx_en_mean: To come into being
To fill with air; inflate
To enlarge (a photographic image or print).
To explode
To lose one's temper.
(of a project) be disrupted by some circumstance

phrase.cizu_name: be blown out of the water

jx.jx_en_mean: (of a person, idea, or project) be shown to lack all credibility
refresh oneself when feeling weary, especially by having some fresh air
jx.jx_cn_mean: （尤指通过呼吸新鲜空气）提神，清醒脑子

jx.jx_en_mean: (informal)kill someone with a shot in the head with a firearm
jx.jx_cn_mean: (非正式)（用枪）击中某人头部将其杀死

jx.jx_en_mean: regard unfavourably
(N. Amer. informal)be considerably better or more successful than
jx.jx_cn_mean: (北美，非正式)远远胜过，比…更为成功

lj.lj_ly: a package that blows the doors off anything on the market.
lj.lj_ls: 一种比市场上任何促销手段远为成功的套餐式销售方法。

jx.jx_en_mean: (informal)lose one's temper

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English  blāwan, of Germanic origin; related to German blähen 'blow up, swell', from an Indo-European root shared by Latin flare 'blow'
late Middle English : of unknown origin
Old English  blōwan, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch bloeien and German blühen, also to bloomand blossom

encyclopedia.content: 建筑工人的儿子乔治荣格不甘于子承父业继续作蓝领，以在海滩贩毒起家，过上了逍遥的日子。可荣格的野心远非如此。荣格成了艾斯科巴将毒品输送到美国的重要枢纽，当时全美消费的可卡因中85%都是经荣格之手从哥伦比亚运来的。在不到十年的时间里，他所赚之多竟让他不得不专门盖一座房子来存放钞票。但是，在金钱与物质上获得极大满足后，荣格也必须忍受精神上的折磨。在女儿克里斯蒂娜眼里，父亲永远是个肮脏的毒贩子，这使荣格痛苦万分，无论多少金钱也无法弥补。最后，作为一个毒枭，他也终究逃不出沦为囚徒的命运。

entry.def: When a wind or breeze blows, the air moves.

example.ex: A chill wind blew at the top of the hill...
example.tran: 山顶寒风呼啸。

example.ex: We woke to find a gale blowing outside.
example.tran: 我们醒来时发现外面狂风大作。

entry.def: If the wind blows something somewhere or if it blows there, the wind moves it there.

example.ex: The wind blew her hair back from her forehead...
example.tran: 风把她前额上的头发吹到了后面。

example.ex: Strong winds blew away most of the dust...
example.tran: 大风卷走了大部分的尘土。

entry.def: If you blow, you send out a stream of air from your mouth.

example.ex: Danny rubbed his arms and blew on his fingers to warm them...
example.tran: 丹尼搓着胳膊并向手指上哈气取暖。

example.ex: Take a deep breath and blow.
example.tran: 深呼吸，吐气。

entry.def: If you blow something somewhere, you move it by sending out a stream of air from your mouth.

example.ex: He picked up his mug and blew off the steam.
example.tran: 他端起杯子，吹走了热气。

entry.def: If you blow bubbles or smoke rings, you make them by blowing air out of your mouth through liquid or smoke.

example.ex: He blew a ring of blue smoke.
example.tran: 他吐出了蓝色的烟圈。

entry.def: When a whistle or horn blows or someone blows it, they make a sound by blowing into it.

example.ex: The whistle blew and the train slid forward...
example.tran: 汽笛鸣响，火车向前滑动。

example.ex: A guard was blowing his whistle.
example.tran: 一个警卫正在吹警笛。

entry.def: When you blow your nose, you force air out of it through your nostrils in order to clear it.

example.ex: He took out a handkerchief and blew his nose.
example.tran: 他掏出一块手帕，擤了擤鼻子。

entry.def: To blow something out ,off, or away means to remove or destroy it violently with an explosion.

example.ex: The can exploded, wrecking the kitchen and bathroom and blowing out windows...
example.tran: 罐子爆炸了，不但炸毁了厨房和浴室，还把窗户炸飞了。

example.ex: Rival gunmen blew the city to bits.
example.tran: 敌人把这座城市炸成了一片废墟。

entry.def: If you say that something blows an event, situation, or argument into a particular extreme state, especially an uncertain or unpleasant state, you mean that it causes it to be in that state.

example.ex: The dramatic World Motor Sports Council meeting in Paris blew the championship wide open as Schumacher was also docked six points...
example.tran: 在巴黎召开的令人瞩目的世界汽车运动理事会会议使冠军归属充满各种可能，因为舒马赫也被扣了6分。

example.ex: Someone took an inappropriate use of words on my part and tried to blow it into a major controversy.
example.tran: 有人不适当地引用我的话，想借此把事情闹大。

entry.def: If you blow a large amount of money, you spend it quickly on luxuries.

example.ex: Before you blow it all on a luxury cruise, give a little thought to the future...
example.tran: 在把钱全砸到一趟海上豪华游之前，多少考虑一下日后怎么办。

example.ex: My brother lent me some money and I went and blew the lot.
example.tran: 我兄弟借给我一些钱，全被我拿去挥霍了。

entry.tran: 失去，断送（机会）；搞砸（努力）
entry.def: If you blow a chance or attempt to do something, you make a mistake which wastes the chance or causes the attempt to fail.

example.ex: He has almost certainly blown his chance of touring India this winter.
example.tran: 他几乎肯定失去了今冬去印度旅行的机会。

example.ex: ...the high-risk world of real estate, where one careless word could blow a whole deal...
example.tran: 一字不慎就可能会断送整笔交易的高风险的房地产业

entry.def: If a fuse blows or if something blows it, the fuse melts because too much electricity has been sent through it, and the electrical current is cut off.

example.ex: The fuse blew as he pressed the button.
example.tran: 他刚一按下按钮，保险丝就烧断了。

entry.def: If you blow a tyre or if it blows, a hole suddenly appears in it and all the air comes out of it.

example.ex: A lorry blew a tyre and careered into them...
example.tran: 一辆货车爆胎了，向他们猛撞了过去。

example.ex: The car tyre blew.
example.tran: 这辆车爆胎了。

entry.def: If you blow your own trumpet or blow your own horn, you tell people that you are very clever or successful.

example.ex: Hollywood cameramen have good reason to blow their own trumpets.
example.tran: 好莱坞的摄影师们有足够的理由可以自我吹嘘。

entry.def: If someone receives a blow, they are hit with a fist or weapon.

example.ex: He went off to hospital after a blow to the face.
example.tran: 他脸部受到重击之后就去了医院。

entry.def: If something that happens is a blow to someone or something, it is very upsetting, disappointing, or damaging to them.

example.ex: When the marriage finally broke up it was obviously a terrible blow to Soames...
example.tran: 婚姻的最终破裂对索姆斯显然是一个沉重打击。

example.ex: That ruling comes as a blow to environmentalists...
example.tran: 那项裁决对环境保护论者来说如同一记闷棍。

entry.def: If two people or groups come to blows, they start fighting.

example.ex: The representatives almost came to blows at a meeting.
example.tran: 代表们在一次会议上差点动起手来。

entry.def: Something that softens the blow or cushions the blow makes an unpleasant change or piece of news easier to accept.

example.ex: Senator Sarbanes expressed concern that programs designed to soften the blow of unemployment are not working well.
example.tran: 旨在缓解失业冲击的项目进展得并不太顺利，参议员萨班斯对此表示关切。

entry.def: If you strike a blow for a particular cause or principle, you do something that supports it or makes it more likely to succeed.

example.ex: The team struck a blow for women's rights by winning the match.
example.tran: 这个小组在比赛中获胜，维护了女性的权利。

means.word_mean: 1. a powerful stroke with the fist or a weapon;

sentences.sentence: "the bump threw him off the bicycle"

means.word_mean: 3. an unfortunate happening that hinders of impedes; something that is thwarting or frustrating

sentences.sentence: "it came as a shock to learn that he was injured"
"the tree was bent almost double by the gust"

means.word_mean: 7. forceful exhalation through the nose or mouth;

sentences.sentence: "he gave his nose a loud blow"
"he blew out all the candles with a single puff"
"blow on the soup to cool it down"

means.word_mean: 3. free of obstruction by blowing air through;
4. be in motion due to some air or water current;

sentences.sentence: "The leaves were blowing in the wind"
"The sailboat was adrift on the open sea"
"the shipwrecked boat drifted away from the shore"

means.word_mean: 5. make a sound as if blown;
7. make a mess of, destroy or ruin;

sentences.sentence: "I botched the dinner and we had to eat out"
"the pianist screwed up the difficult passage in the second movement"
"He wasted his inheritance on his insincere friends"
"You squandered the opportunity to get and advanced degree"
"He blew a lot of money on his new home theater"

means.word_mean: 10. sound by having air expelled through a tube;
11. play or sound a wind instrument;
12. provide sexual gratification through oral stimulation
13. cause air to go in, on, or through;
14. cause to move by means of an air current;

sentences.sentence: "The wind blew the leaves around in the yard"

means.word_mean: 15. spout moist air from the blowhole;
18. cause to be revealed and jeopardized;

sentences.sentence: "The double agent was blown by the other side"

means.word_mean: 21. melt, break, or become otherwise unusable;

example.en: I just knew you'd blow your lid.
example.zh: 我就知道你会发脾气的。

list.explanation: (黑社会用语)匆匆或赶紧离开、离去

example.en: Come on, let's blow the joint before there's trouble.
example.zh: 快走，在出麻烦之前我们赶紧离开这儿。

example.en: They blew the joint about an hour ago.
example.zh: 他们在大概一小时前匆匆走了。

list.explanation: 呼唤(某人)，向(某人)打招呼或行礼

example.en: An old friend gave me a blow from the other side of the street.
example.zh: 一位老朋友在街道对面朝我打招呼。

example.en: I'll tell you what happened blow by blow.
example.zh: 我会把所发生的事一五一十告诉你。

example.en: The book gave a blow by blow account of the historical event.
example.zh: 那本书对于那次历史亊件作了很详细的叙述。

auth_sentence.content: Hearing this was like a blow to the head.
auth_sentence.res_content: Hearing this was like a blow to the head.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Hearing this was like a blow to the head.

auth_sentence.content: We blow out and relight the pilots each morning.
auth_sentence.res_content: We blow out and relight the pilots each morning.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: We blow out and relight the pilots each morning.

auth_sentence.content: We understood they wanted to blow up the plant.
auth_sentence.res_content: We understood they wanted to blow up the plant.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: We understood they wanted to blow up the plant.

Sentence.sentence: Comparing 1929 with 2007-09, Christina Romer, the head of President Obama's Council of Economic Advisers, finds the initial blow to confidence far greater now than then.
Its initial blow to confidence far exceeded that of
We can tear apart the great grass cover of the western plains and pour toxic chemicals into the soil until the soil is dead and blows away in the wind.

sentences.en: He gave him a violent blow on the head.
sentences.cn: 他照他的头部重重一击。
风越刮越大, 终于形成一场飓风。

sentences.en: He took out his flute, and blew at it.

jushi.english: It began to blow quite hard, just before midnight.
jushi.chinese: 在午夜之前,就开始刮起了狂风。

jushi.english: The curtains blew in the wind.
